Entries.default: "Think this'll break me? It won't!"
"Spit on me, and I'll make you regret it. One day. Surely."
"Benweth's crew uses horn blasts for an alarm?"
"Why're you being punished?"
[Spit in her face.]
"Deadlight's huge. Horns are the most reliable means to sound an alert. We got signals for ships docking or leaving, changes in the tides, invaders, and so on."
"I sounded the call for mutiny. Tried to end it, but got my signals backwards. It's one long blow, not two short ones - for when danger's abated."
"Don't think I regret it. I'd do it again - but better."
"Those hagfish! Benweth's crew lashed me up to be, and I quote, 'a deterrent to insubordination.'"
"It's sharkshit! All I did was filch one of their horns and blast it to startle Ungwith. I wanted to see her get all worked up."
"As far as pranks go, it wasn't a half-bad plan. But they caught me before I could blow the stand down signal..."
She jerks against the post, shaking her head to dislodge the spit, but it only slides down her cheek in a slow, glutinous trail.
"Some day you're going to be having a real good dream about a pretty lass who's still got all her eyes and teeth giving you a below kiss."
Entries.female: "Some day you're going to be having a real good dream about a handsome fellow who's still got all his eyes and teeth giving you a below kiss."

Entries.default: "I'll cut you loose."
"Not that I ain't grateful... but if Ben's crew spots me about, they'll be taking more than my pride next."
[Cut the ropes.] "Benweth won't be troubling you any time soon."
[Cut the ropes.] "Don't get caught again."
"Good point. Wait here."
"Blind me, someone got the best of Brutal Benny? Come drink with me at the Court, sometime. You'd best believe, I'll be celebrating this blessing from the gods."
"Suppose I'll do my best." She flicks you a sly smile in parting.
"Like I could go anywhere?"
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Sod you!"
"Then you're going to wake to me standing over you with a knife."

"Well, sure. But shouldn't you know this... on account of you being a captain?"

She tilts her head back, gazing suspiciously at you from beneath her lashes.
"I used to sail for Furrante. He runs things differently."
"Of course, I'm a pirate... uh, matey."
"That he does, the master rogue. You should've come to us sooner. We're accepting of even old bloods if they're wanting to run fresh."
"I don't think I should tell you this... but I suppose it serves those lubbernecks right..."
"My fist will be captain of your face if you question me again."
"Uh huh..." She licks her lips.
With a scowl, she twists against the ropes. Then she gives up, sagging.
"Much better, now."
